metadata.pricing_model: Included in Dropbox Business/Enterprise; free as DIY methodology

description.short: Feature or methodology for defining and enforcing company-specific brand voice, tone, terminology, and style in AI-generated content
description.detailed: Company Voice Guide is both a specific Dropbox Dash feature and a general methodology for ensuring AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, Dash) produce content that matches a company's brand identity. Users upload or create documentation specifying preferred terminology (e.g., 'customers' not 'users'), tone (formal vs. casual), writing style, formatting conventions, and examples of on-brand vs. off-brand content. When AI generates text, it references this guide to maintain consistency. In Dropbox Dash, this is a dedicated feature; in other tools, it's achieved via custom instructions or system prompts. This is critical for customer-facing content, marketing materials, and maintaining brand integrity at scale.
description.primary_function: Ensure AI-generated content consistently matches company brand voice and style guidelines
key_capabilities: Define brand-specific terminology and word choices
Provide examples of on-brand vs. off-brand content
Integrate with AI tools (Dash, ChatGPT, Copilot)
Version and update guidelines over time
Validate AI outputs against brand standards
Support multiple brand voices (e.g., different products)

use_cases.title: Generate Brand-Consistent Marketing Copy
use_cases.description: Ensure all AI-generated social posts, email campaigns, and ad copy use approved terminology and match brand tone
use_cases.time_saved: 15-30 minutes per content piece (reduced editing/revision cycles)
use_cases.user_persona: Marketing teams, content creators, social media managers

use_cases.title: Maintain Consistency Across Customer Support Responses
use_cases.description: Generate support replies that use company-preferred language and empathetic tone without manual review of every response
use_cases.time_saved: 10-15 minutes per support ticket (faster resolution with quality)

use_cases.title: Onboard New Team Members to Brand Voice
use_cases.description: New hires reference Voice Guide to quickly learn and adopt company communication standards
use_cases.time_saved: 5-10 hours per new hire (accelerated brand voice learning)
use_cases.user_persona: New employees, hiring managers, HR teams

use_cases.title: Standardize Internal Documentation Tone
use_cases.description: Ensure technical docs, wiki pages, and internal memos follow consistent style and terminology

use_cases.title: Localized Content with Brand Consistency
use_cases.description: Create Voice Guides for different regions/languages to maintain brand identity in localized content
use_cases.time_saved: 1-2 hours per localized content piece (faster translation + brand alignment)

typical_sections.description: Define brand traits (e.g., friendly, innovative, trustworthy, playful)
typical_sections.example: Dropbox is approachable, helpful, and human—never corporate or jargon-heavy

typical_sections.description: Specify formality level, emotional tone, and context-specific adjustments
typical_sections.example: Conversational and warm in marketing; professional but friendly in support; technical but clear in docs

typical_sections.description: Preferred terms, forbidden words, industry jargon handling
typical_sections.example: Say 'customers' not 'users'; avoid 'leverage' and 'utilize'; explain acronyms on first use

typical_sections.description: Active vs. passive voice, sentence length, punctuation preferences
typical_sections.example: Use active voice; keep sentences under 20 words; use Oxford comma

typical_sections.description: Headers, bullet points, bold/italic usage, emoji policy
typical_sections.example: Use sentence case for headers; bullet points for lists >3 items; no emojis in enterprise content

typical_sections.description: Side-by-side comparisons of on-brand vs. off-brand content
typical_sections.example: ✅ 'We're here to help!' vs. ❌ 'Our support team will assist you with your inquiry'

setup_steps: Upload existing brand guidelines (PDF/Doc) or create new
AI analyzes and extracts key patterns
AI automatically applies guidelines to Dash-generated content

diy_implementation.chatgpt_custom_instructions: Add brand guidelines to 'Custom Instructions' in ChatGPT settings
diy_implementation.claude_projects: Create Claude Project with brand guidelines in project context
diy_implementation.general_approach: Prepend brand guidelines to every prompt (manual but universal)

creation_process: Audit existing brand materials (style guides, marketing materials, support templates)
Provide 3-5 before/after examples for each principle
Test with AI tool on sample tasks
Share with team and iterate based on feedback

WF-MARKETING-001: Create Social Media Post with Brand Voice
WF-SUPPORT-001: Draft Customer Support Response with Empathy

learning_curve.basic_proficiency: 1-2 days (integrate with AI tools, test outputs)

quality_improvements: 85% reduction in off-brand content (measured by review flags)
90% consistency in terminology usage (vs. 40% without guide)
team_value: Faster onboarding for content creators (5-10 hours saved per new hire)
Scalable content production without sacrificing quality
Single source of truth for brand standards
roi_metrics.value_proposition: Critical for companies with strong brand identity, customer-facing AI content, or distributed content teams

guide_creation: Start with 5-10 core principles (expand later if needed)
Prioritize examples over rules (AI learns better from examples)
Include context-specific guidelines (marketing vs. support vs. internal)
Version the guide (v1.0, v2.0) and date stamp updates
Test with real AI outputs before company-wide rollout
maintenance: Review quarterly or after major brand refreshes
Track common violations (add rules to address patterns)
Gather feedback from content teams (what's missing?)
Update examples with real-world on/off-brand outputs
Align with updated brand strategy or product positioning
team_adoption: Train teams on how to use Voice Guide with AI tools
Designate 'brand champion' to maintain and evangelize
Make guide easily discoverable (link in Slack, wiki, etc.)
Celebrate good examples of on-brand AI content

known_limitations: AI may still produce off-brand content occasionally (not 100% reliable)
Guide effectiveness depends on quality of documentation
Requires initial time investment to create comprehensive guide
May need different guides for different AI tools (platform-specific)
Difficult to codify highly nuanced brand voices
Requires periodic updates as brand evolves
limitations.best_for: Companies with strong brand identity, customer-facing content, distributed teams, high content volume
limitations.not_ideal_for: Startups without established brand, internal-only tools, purely technical content
